intro: Limonium procerum subsp. cambrense, commonly known as the Welsh sea campion, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of western Britain. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and produces clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is adapted to salty, wind-swept conditions. Its small, showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
